function to_binary(n) result(bin_str)
   integer, intent(in) :: n
   character(len=:), allocatable :: bin_str
   integer :: temp, remainder
   bin_str = ''
   if (n == 0) then
      bin_str = '0'
      return
   end if
   temp = n
   do while (temp > 0)
      remainder = mod(temp, 2) bin_str = char(ichar('0') + remainder) // bin_str
      temp = temp / 2
   end do
end function to_binary

program main

   implicit none

   integer :: n

   integer*8 :: first_step, second_result

   logical :: third_result

   read(*,*) n

   first_step = (n /3)*2 + (mod(n,3) /=0)

   call second_step(first_step, second_result)

   call third_step(second_result, third_result) if (third_result) then

      print *, 'Yes'

   else

      print *, 'No'

   end if

contains

   subroutine second_step(input_num, output_val)

      integer*8, intent(in) :: input_num

      integer*8, intent(out) :: output_val

      integer :: mask

      integer*8 :: value

      character(len=100) :: bin_str, s, temp_str

      integer :: zeros, ones, i, len_s

      mask =2

      value =0

      do while (value < input_num)

         bin_str = to_binary(mask)

         s = bin_str(2:)

         zeros =0

         ones =0

         do i=1, len_trim(s)

             if (s(i:i) == '0') then

                 zeros = zeros +1

             else

                 ones = ones +1

             end if

         end do

         if (zeros == ones) then

             temp_str = s

             do i=1, len_trim(temp_str)

                 if (temp_str(i:i) == '0') then

                     temp_str(i:i) = '4'

                 else

                     temp_str(i:i) = '7'

                 end if

             end do

             read(temp_str, '(I10)') value

         end if

         mask = mask +1

      end do

      output_val = value

   end subroutine second_step

   function to_binary(n) result(bin_str)
      integer, intent(in) :: n
      character(len=:), allocatable :: bin_str
      integer :: temp, remainder
      bin_str = ''
      if (n == 0) then
         bin_str = '0'
         return
      end if
      temp = n
      do while (temp > 0)
         remainder = mod(temp, 2) bin_str = char(ichar('0') + remainder) // bin_str
         temp = temp / 2
      end do
   end function to_binary

   subroutine third_step(input_num, result)

      integer*8, intent(in) :: input_num

      logical, intent(out) :: result

      character(len=20) :: s

      integer :: counts(256) =0

      integer :: i, num_chars=0

      write(s, '(I0)') input_num

      do i=1, len_trim(s)

         counts(ichar(s(i:i))) = counts(ichar(s(i:i))) +1

      end do
